summary.p: The Kācikāṇṭam, The book of Kāci, that is Kāśī (Benares), is a Tamil version of the Kāśīkhaṇḍa of the late version of the Sanskrit Skandapurāṇa. The Kācikāṇṭam is the work of the Teṉkāci (Southern Kāśī) king Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, who ruled in the second half of the 16th century. See Raghavan (1960, p. 235). On Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, best known for his Naiṭatam, a Tamil version of the Sanskrit Naiṣadha by Harṣa, see Shulman (2012, pp. 155ff.).
The text is incomplete. See above description of U3 and mention of missing folios.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, invocation page, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statement, colophon, table of contents/total stanzas (U3, f295‒f297).

collation.desc: The palm-leaf bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains, on the front woodcover: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: b/38.

286 folios (f1‒f2, f74‒f75, f76.1, f76.2 unblackened), Tamil foliation 2‒297 (f77, f96‒f101, f131, f148, f178, f257 missing; three successive f70, two successive f76, two succesive f257) = text (mūlam), 6 to 8 lines per page, by several hands (?), different from hand n° 1. The foliation discontinuity parallels, but not always, a textual discontinuity. The manuscript appears to be a collective work by several scribes, thus the inconsistent foliation.

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).

encodingDesc.p: Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Transliteration conventions. Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; , , ; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
